jparsec.io

Class Serialization

  • java.lang.Object
    • jparsec.io.Serialization

  • public class Serialization
extends java.lang.Object
    A class to read and write serializable objects using static methods.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    T. Alonso Albi - OAN (Spain)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static long INVALID_SUID
      ID for an invalid serial version.

    • Method Detail

      • getSerialVersionUID

        public static long getSerialVersionUID(java.lang.String classPath)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Obtain the serial version of a class.
        Parameters:
        classPath - Path for the class.
        Returns:
        Its serial version.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • getSerialVersionUID

        public static long getSerialVersionUID(java.io.InputStream is)
                                throws JPARSECException
        Obtain the serial version of an already serialized object.
        Parameters:
        is - Input stream to a given serialized object. The next object in the stream is read and the UID returned. In case mark is supported the read position in the stream is reset so that the same object can be read later.
        Returns:
        Its serial version.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • writeObject

        public static void writeObject(java.lang.Object serialObject,
               java.lang.String filePath)
                        throws JPARSECException
        Writes an object using serialization.
        Parameters:
        serialObject - A serializable object.
        filePath - Path for the file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • readObject

        public static java.lang.Object readObject(java.lang.String filePath)
                                   throws JPARSECException
        Reads an object using serialization.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path for the file.
        Returns:
        The object.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • writeObjects

        public static void writeObjects(java.lang.Object[] serialObject,
                java.lang.String filePath)
                         throws JPARSECException
        Writes several objects using serialization.
        Parameters:
        serialObject - A serializable object array.
        filePath - Path for the file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

                         throws JPARSECException
        Writes several objects using serialization.
        Parameters:
        serialObject - A serializable object array.
        filePath - Path for the file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • readObjects

        public static java.lang.Object[] readObjects(java.lang.String filePath)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Reads several objects using serialization.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path for the file.
        Returns:
        The object array.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • readObjectsSkipErrors

        public static java.lang.Object[] readObjectsSkipErrors(java.lang.String filePath,
                                       int[] skipIndexes)
                                                throws java.lang.Exception
        Reads several objects using serialization, skipping possible errors. Should not be used, since it could hang the process.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path for the file.
        skipIndexes - Indexes (starting from 0) of the objects that will be skipped, the other will be read.
        Returns:
        The object array. Indexes of the skipped objects will contain null, so the length will be the same as the number of objects in the input file.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.
        java.lang.Exception

      • readObjects

        public static java.lang.Object[] readObjects(java.lang.String filePath,
                             int nObj)
                                      throws JPARSECException
        Reads several objects using serialization.
        Parameters:
        filePath - Path for the file.
        nObj - Number of objects to read.
        Returns:
        The object array.
        Throws:
        JPARSECException - If an error occurs.

      • copy

        public static java.lang.Object copy(java.lang.Object orig)
        Returns a copy of the object, or null if the object cannot be serialized.
        Parameters:
        orig - Original object.
        Returns:
        The copy, or null if it is not serializable.
